The actions of the Buddha and the Saṅgha: Sat against the central column facing east (Buddha)
Sat against the west wall facing east (Saṅgha of mendicants)
Sat against the east wall facing west (Sakyans of Kapilavatthu)
The Buddha spent most of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the Sakyans with a Dhamma talk
The explanation of the corrupt and the u: A mendicant who sees a sight with the eye
If it’s pleasant they hold on to it, but if it’s unpleasant they dislike it
They live with mindfulness of the body unestablished and their heart restricted
They don’t truly understand the freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom where those arisen bad, unskillful qualities cease without anything left over
They hear a sound … smell an odor … taste a flavor … feel a touch … know a thought with the mind
If it’s pleasant they hold on to it, but if it’s unpleasant they dislike it
They live with mindfulness of the body unestablished and a limited heart
They don’t truly understand the freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom where those arisen bad, unskillful qualities cease without anything left over
This is called a mendicant who is corrupt when it comes to sights known by the eye, sounds … smells … tastes … touches … thoughts known by the mind
They’re mastered by sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts, they don’t master these things
Bad, unskillful qualities have mastered them, which are defiled, leading to future lives, hurtful, and resulting in suffering and future rebirth, old age, and death
A mendicant who sees a sight with the eye
If it’s pleasant they don’t hold on to it, and if it’s unpleasant they don’t dislike it
They live with mindfulness of the body established and a limitless heart
They truly understand the freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom where those arisen bad, unskillful qualities cease without anything left over
They hear a sound … smell an odor … taste a flavor … feel a touch … know a thought with the mind
If it’s pleasant they don’t hold on to it, and if it’s unpleasant they don’t dislike it
They live with mindfulness of the body established and a limitless heart
They truly understand the freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom where those arisen bad, unskillful qualities cease without anything left over
This is called a mendicant who is uncorrupted when it comes to sights known by the eye, sounds … smells … tastes … touches … thoughts known by the mind
They master sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts, they’re not mastered by these things
Bad, unskillful qualities have been mastered by them, which are defiled, leading to future lives, hurtful, and resulting in suffering and future rebirth, old age, and death.
